channel.title: Games lagging
channel.description:
I just got a HTC Wildfire yesterday and tried some game applications I downloaded from the Android Market. When I launch the downloaded games, they run really slowly. Does it have anything to do with the frames per second?
Some technical stuff about the phone:
[ul][li]http://www.htc.com/sea/product/wildfire/specification.html[/li] [li]Android OS 2.1 (update 1)[/li][/ul]

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Rix_:

Overclocking will only do good to games that aren’t graphics-heavy.

ninwarriors being the least graphics heavy game ive ever seen, almost

Rix_:

Also the battery life of this phone is horrible; it went from 100% to 30% in just 4 hours of use.

Mine frequents 9-11 days on standby with a few hours web surfan, phone and texting m8…

Ps turn screen brightness down far, will help loads

and maybe install a power widget so u can turn wifi and bollocks off when not in use

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

That happens with all new phones with big touchscreens and processors

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Did some searching, turns out it’s the phone’s GPU that sucks. Overclocking will only do good to games that aren’t graphics-heavy. Also the battery life of this phone is horrible; it went from 100% to 30% in just 4 hours of use.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

because the 70~mhz will make all the difference

but in all seriousness, if a 533mhz cpu on another device can emulate and play yoshis island snes without nearly as much lag as ninwarriors, I’d say there’s something wrong with the program and not the cpu…

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:13, topic:380711”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=476534.msg3486264#msg3486264 date=1296599631]
Your processor looks to be the worst out of any Android phone I have seen.
[/quote][quote author=Ollie link=topic=476534.msg3487120#msg3487120 date=1296673020]
Wildfire is a shit phone, its expensive and offers poor processor speed.
[/quote]
FFFFFFF, what’s a decent processor speed?[/quote]1ghz is decent. 600 is too slow. My Aria has that and when you’re writing a text and then recieve a text in the middle of that, it lags like crazy and fucks the keys up a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

600mhz is the min you want now, 1ghz is standard and 1.2ghz is the fastest, you can overclock the newer ones as well to well over 1.6.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Pwnd:

Your processor looks to be the worst out of any Android phone I have seen.[/quote][quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:380711”]Wildfire is a shit phone, its expensive and offers poor processor speed.

FFFFFFF, what’s a decent processor speed?

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Wildfire is a shit phone, its expensive and offers poor processor speed. The ZTE Blade, or Orange San Francisco as it is called is a much better option (cheaper, faster and more reliable) and it plays those game without any lag at all.

I’d take it back and get a different phone.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:4, topic:380711”][quote author=Niall link=topic=476534.msg3485077#msg3485077 date=1296489097]
What games? I have a wildfire and can see if i have the same issues you do.
[/quote]
They’re Angry Birds (14MB) and Ninjump (4MB?).[/quote]

If angry birds actually displayed correctly rather than somewhere off-screen I’d tell you my results, ninjump is a little sluggish but still totally playable.

Read full topic

how does that improve it when its another app running on top of android?

@mwiebelhaus wrote:

install a different launcher on it that should improve performance a bit.

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can always ‘unroot’ it and flash it back to stock, so while rooted your warranty might be void, but it can be undone.

Also 2.2 is substantially (like over twice as much) faster than 2.1 or any other previous android version because of optimizations done on the JIT compiler, so it will definitely make your phone quite a bit faster.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Run linpack for android as a benchmark if you want to see how different ROMs perform on your phone.

Obviously a higher score indicates better performance. I’m not too clued up on the wildfire though.

Read full topic

item.title: Games lagging
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Teh Spede:

Root it and put a custom rom. Then overclock that bitch! You’ll also get Android 2.2!

I’m thinking about whether to root it or not. I don’t know if that voids my warranty.

Niall:

What games? I have a wildfire and can see if i have the same issues you do.

They’re Angry Birds (14MB) and Ninjump (4MB?).

Read full topic
